brewery.brewery_description: We are craft beer crusaders who stand tall and never eat shit.

items.badge_description: It's the final week! Week 4 wraps with the last 3 styles of this year's Year in Beer Style Hunt. You've just tried one of three available styles during the week.

There's beer in them thar hills! You're setting off on your journey through the world of beer, but be sure to take a little time to get to know each brewery as you go. That's a beer from 230 different breweries. Try 5 more for Level 47!
99 bottles of beer on the wall, 99 bottles of beer. Take one down, pass it around.... That's 95 checkins with the serving style of Bottle. Try 5 more for Level 20!

user.bio: I am not a drunk! I'm a connoisseur.

beer.beer_description: Imperial Red

items.badge_description: It's the final week! Week 4 wraps with the last 3 styles of this year's Year in Beer Style Hunt. You've just tried one of three available styles during the week.

beer.beer_description:
Available exclusively in our Hop Pack Variety Pack. 

Inhale - an explosion of fruit will parade in your nasal cavity - bright strawberry, mandarin, and peach with a hint of pine and green hops balance out this kick ass trifecta of hoppy citrus perfection. But don't forget about your mouth hole. The aroma is just foreplay for the main event, so drink up.

Originally a Wild Dog release commemorating our 10th anniversary. Double Dog Double Pale Ale became here to stay in 2009. Could you control such a beast?

This is a big beer that calls for equally big foods. Flavor notes: Citrus hops with sweet malt and subtle alcohol burn (like a kiss on the cheek) Pairs with: Extra sharp aged Cheddar and stinky Blue cheese; smoked brisket; spicy foods with chili or cayenne pepper; earthy desserts like carrot cake.

Developed alongside over a dozen Single-Hop Imperial IPAs. The truth was three years in the making and has some of the most unique hop varieties available today.

The Truth's sharp hop bitterness begins with pine on the nose and evolves into bright citrus and subtle stone fruit flavors. Pair this beer with sharp cheddar cheese and light, spicy proteins.

items.badge_description: While spontaneity can be fun, sometimes you want to make sure your adventure will rock. Checkout the menu at an Untappd Verified Venue before visiting and know exactly what’s on tap! That's 245 check-ins at venue that is verified. Try 5 more for Level 50!

beer.beer_description: Black Lager

user.bio:
Just a casual beer drinker who likes to backpack.

Writing one chapter at a time in the beer diary.

Cheers!

items.badge_description: It's the final week! Week 4 wraps with the last 3 styles of this year's Year in Beer Style Hunt. You've just tried one of three available styles during the week.
It's the final week! Week 4 wraps with the last 3 styles of this year's Year in Beer Style Hunt. You've just tried one of three available styles during the week.

beer.beer_description:
Developed alongside over a dozen Single-Hop Imperial IPAs. The truth was three years in the making and has some of the most unique hop varieties available today.

The Truth's sharp hop bitterness begins with pine on the nose and evolves into bright citrus and subtle stone fruit flavors. Pair this beer with sharp cheddar cheese and light, spicy proteins.

items.badge_description: Looking for more kick than a session beer, but want to be able to stay for a few rounds? You have to keep it in the middle. That's 130 beers with an ABV greater than 5% and less than 10%. Try 5 more for Level 27!
Load up those hops, watch the IBU grow and drink it down! Now you’re all hopped up. The more bitter, the better. That's 10 different beers with an IBU of 65 or higher. Try 5 more for Level 3!
We believe in IPA and you should too. You certainly have a taste for the hops! That's 10 different IPAs. Try 5 more for Level 3! Want to learn more about this badge? Check out our podcast

When a single isn’t enough, make it a double. Doubling the hops and malts in a recipe results in a higher ABV and can pack quite a boozey punch. That's 30 different beers with the style that contains Imperial / Double in its style name. Try 5 more for Level 7!

items.checkin_comment: Been saving this one; unfortunately it’s no longer produced; a nice seasonal winter ale.

beer.beer_description: Put on your parka. Lace up those snow boots. Walk outside and soak up that 27 minutes of sunlight. It’s winter! After a long day of sliding across icy parking lots on your face, there’s no better way to beat back the cold than with K-9 Winter Warmer, a strong English ale teeming with deep malty flavor and nutty spiciness. Pull up a seat by the fireplace with a slice of spice cake or a bowl of hearty stew, and let K-9 thaw your soul in ways a Snuggie™ never could.

items.badge_description: Looking for more kick than a session beer, but want to be able to stay for a few rounds? You have to keep it in the middle. That's 390 beers with an ABV greater than 5% and less than 10%.  Try 5 more for Level 79!

beer.beer_description: Black Lager

items.badge_description: At first taste, dark ales can be overwhelming for even the most skilled of beer drinkers, but your will is weak and with time you will eventually turn to the dark side. That's 15 different beers with the style of Dark Ale, Belgian Strong Dark Ale, Lager - Dark, IPA - Black / Cascadian Dark Ale or IPA - Imperial / Double Black, Schwarzbier, or Mild - Dark. Try 5 more for Level 4!

beer.beer_description: Imperial Red

items.badge_description: It's time to give bottle shops some love by adding them as your purchased location. That's 35 check-ins with a purchased location! Tag 5 more to get to Level 8. Want to learn more about this badge? Check out our podcast

beer.beer_description: Two inflammatory words...one wild drink. Nectar imprisoned in a bottle. An anything-but-delicate blend of sharp hoppiness and fruity aroma, this beer is a life-changing backyard knife-fight for your palate. Once you’ve had a Raging Bitch, everything else pales in comparison. Fermented with a volcano-like Belgian yeast strain called “El Diablo,” Raging Bitch earned its polarizing name from the aggressively active nature of the yeast—unleashed, untamed, unbridled...and in heat. Enjoy its golden glow and white foaming head alongside bold flavors like spicy BBQ wings, blue cheese salads, or that bag of family-sized Cool Ranch Doritos you’re going to destroy later while binge-watching Netflix.

A potent snakebite of Citra, Mosaic, Warrior, Simcoe, and Columbus hops (more than 2lbs per barrel) gives this beer its citrus-forward superpower. Orange and tropical fruit aromas temper slightly-piney crispness, turning Snake Dog into a more complex breed of West Coast IPA. You’ll find Snake Dog bites hardest when paired with peppery cheeses, curries, and mild Thai dishes whose names you can’t pronounce properly.

Originally a small-batch release in the spring of 2013. Bloodline is brewed with blood orange peel and blood orange juice and hits the perfect balance between  citrus sweetness and bitterness.

Bloodline begins with huge grapefruit on the nose. Then, a delicate balance of citrus sweetness and bitterness. Try it with grilled light proteins, salads with fruity vinaigrettes, and fresh salsa.
Citrus, grassy, and slight perfume hop character balanced with a sweet malt body.

Developed alongside over a dozen Single-Hop Imperial IPAs. The truth was three years in the making and has some of the most unique hop varieties available today.

The Truth's sharp hop bitterness begins with pine on the nose and evolves into bright citrus and subtle stone fruit flavors. Pair this beer with sharp cheddar cheese and light, spicy proteins.

Gonzo is big, bold, and beautiful like the man it was brewed in honor of – Dr. Hunter S. Thompson. Flavor notes: Roasted chocolate, coffee, and vanilla malt flavors balanced with a unique hop bite Pairs with: Mushrooms; smoked meats, BBQ, and chili; hard cheese; chocolate and coffee desserts

"It never got weird enough for me."
-Hunter S. Thompson

Now available in 15pk cans!

This sessionable and delicious IPA has huge citrus notes, a crisp, clean malt backbone and a subtle hop profile for ultimate drinkability. Super crushable with a smooth finish, this is the Easy choice for an afternoon of IPAs.

beer.beer_name: Dead Rise Old Bay Summer Ale
beer.beer_description:
Dead Rise was brewed to celebrate OLD BAY's 75th anniversary and proceeds benefit True Blue, a program that advocates on behalf of the Chesapeake Bay's 5,500 watermen.

Dead Rise was brewed to highlight the indelible, bold character of OLD BAY with citrus hop notes and a crisp, tart finish. Pair it with tables piled high with shrimp, corn, and Maryland Blue Crab.

Originally a Wild Dog release commemorating our 10th anniversary. Double Dog Double Pale Ale became here to stay in 2009. Could you control such a beast?

This is a big beer that calls for equally big foods. Flavor notes: Citrus hops with sweet malt and subtle alcohol burn (like a kiss on the cheek) Pairs with: Extra sharp aged Cheddar and stinky Blue cheese; smoked brisket; spicy foods with chili or cayenne pepper; earthy desserts like carrot cake.
Brewed with agave nectar and lime peel, it's the artisanal answer to the easy-drinking, south-of-the-border light lagers.

Why is there only one time of year when we embrace THE FEAR? At all other times, THE FEAR dominates us, controls us, and prevents us from greatness. Whatever THE FEAR is that consumes you, learn to embrace it. Only then will the true artist in your rise up.

Brewed with 100% imported German ingredients, it will cut spice while pulling out sweetness. Flavor notes: Full-bodied caramel and graham cracker sweetness with light toasted notes and a clean, crisp finish.
So juicy, brah. Thunderpeel Hazy IPA is brewed with Citra, Galaxy, Mosaic, and is unfiltered for your pleasure.

While karma's biting you in the ass, it's kissing his. A profit of prosperity, he's the guy you love to hate. And just when you think his fate's on the brink, that bastard's life falls right back into place.

You know the rules, Karen. Don’t talk to me until I’ve had my coffee beer. This velvety smooth porter is brewed in partnership with our good friends at Vigilante Coffee Co., making it the perfect brunch compliment to home fries, short stacks, and yelling at birds that keep trying to steal your toast.

Royal Crush Juicy IPA is an amped up, “citra-fied” version of the orange crush ale you know and love. Made with 100% Citra hops, this juice bomb is sure to tingle your taste buds. Same great name, with a bigger, bolder citrus forward POW.

For over 10 years Flying Dog and the Oyster Recovery Partnership have worked together to keep the Chesapeake Bay ecosystem healthy and thriving, adding millions of baby oysters back into the Bay. So crack open this beer and pat yourself on the back. For every Royal Crush Juicy IPA you drink, you’re adding 10 little bivalves back into the Bay.

Brewed in the deep end, this beer is built for breaking into your neighbor's pool for some summertime day drinking, or for kicking it on the back deck with nothing to do. Hazy, fruity, and light on both bitterness and ABV, Pool Hopping embodies everything you love about summer. So order some new swim trunks, practice your cannonballs, and we'll meet you at the diving board.

A one-two combo of sweet and tart that stuns you with a pucker punch. If you
even dream of a better sour, you better wake up and apologize.

For years, she's gone walking. When she passes, she lures you in. And time after glorious time, she never disappoints. Tall and tan and young and lovely. You smile. With a swing so cool and a sway so gentle, you'll give your heart gladly.

This year, with guava, pineapple and tangerine.
This supercharged hazy IPA thrills with an alternating current of juicy guava and tropical fruit notes. But proceed with caution, at 6.8% ABV, Hop Electric is a real live wire.

With light malt notes and a slightly-floral hop character, this beer tastes like good tidings of comfort and joy. Which is good because Uncle Frank is here, ready to give his annual update on body parts that hurt.

Remember what it was like to feel your fingers? Us neither. Welcome to winter. You wake up, put on 6 pairs of underwear, then go outside to enjoy your 8 minutes of daylight. So stack that firewood, crack open a Freezin’ Season, and tell seasonal affective disorder to go $%*# itself. Yeah, it’s cold outside. But inside, this spiced winter ale always keeps the bonfire burning.

Why choose one kind of breakfast, when you can have them all? This Willett Bourbon barrel-aged brew is the perfect compliment to all things breakfast. Oatmeal. Waffle. Buttered toast. Cafe Lattes with cocoa-vanilla whipped cream. Don't just raid the cupboard, rip it off the wall. Then wash it down with a deep-flavored coffee vanilla stout that almost makes getting out of bed worth it. Almost.

Cookies And Cream Milk Stout. Tip toe to the fridge. Avoid the creaky floorboard. Slooowly opening the fridge… Wait a minute – you’re a goddamn adult and can have cookies any time you want! Inspired by the best dessert combo ever created, Cream Team was born from a love of that last swig of milk after you’ve dipped 2, 3, 4 – okay 5 cookies – in it. So drink up; calories don’t count after midnight.

Salesman extraordinaire, Steve Olintz, likes a beer that gets straight to the point and takes you to your happy place ASAP. So he dared our brewers to see how far they could push the ABV on our already high-octane Double Dog IPA. The result? A smooth-drinking monster Triple that clocks in at a whopping 18%. Enjoy the ride, ‘cuz this trains headed to Feelinggoodville, USA.
